posts.title: BWF World Tour Finals: Srikanth goes down to Kunlavut Vitidsarn; Ashwini-Sikki suffer second successive defeat
posts.desc: World number 14 Srikanth, who had reached the knockout stage in the 2014 edition of the year-ending event, went down 18-21 7-21 to three-time junior world champion Vitidsarn in a 46-minute men's singles match.

posts.title: Novak Djokovic says he 'supports fully' WTA's decision to suspend tournaments in China
posts.desc: WTA Tour chairman Steve Simon on Wednesday announced the "immediate suspension" of all its tournaments in China, including Hong Kong over concerns about the safety of female player Peng Shuai, who accused a top Communist Party official of sexual assault.

posts.title: Ligue 1: Quiet night for Lionel Messi after seventh Ballon d'Or win as Nice hold PSG to goalless draw
posts.desc: Despite the draw, PSG are 12 points clear at the top of the French table from Marseille, who climbed up to second with a 1-0 win at 10-man Nantes

posts.title: LaLiga: Karim Benzema helps Real Madrid beat Athletic Bilbao, solidify themselves at top of the table
posts.desc: Benzema's 20th goal in 24 games this season proved the difference in a 1-0 victory at the Santiago Bernabeu that puts Madrid firmly in charge of the Spanish title race, even after only 15 games played.

posts.title: BWF World Tour Finals: Satwik-Chirag pair pulls out of tournament due to injury
posts.desc: Satwik and Chirag, ranked 11th in the World, had become the first Indian men's doubles pair to qualify for the prestigious season-ending tournament after finishing at the semifinal stage of the Indonesia Open Super 1000 tournament last week.

posts.title: Anju Bobby George wins World Athletics' Woman of the Year Award
posts.desc: The 44-year-old Anju, the only Indian to have won a medal in the World Championships with a long jump bronze in the 2003 edition, was named for the award in the world body's annual awards night.

posts.title: Serie A: Milan clubs breathing down Napoli's neck after league leaders waste two-goal lead against Sassuolo
posts.desc: AC Milan are just one point back in second and Inter Milan another point behind in third following their respective wins over Genoa and Spezia while Napoli were held to a 2-2 draw by Sassuolo.

posts.title: Major League Baseball locks out players in first work stoppage since 1994
posts.desc: In a "Letter to Fans" posted on Twitter, MLB commissioner Rob Manfred said he was disappointed that the league was "forced to commence a lockout of Major League Players, effective at 12:01 am on December 2."

posts.title: Indian women lose 1-2 to Venezuela in four-nation football tournament
posts.desc: Ranked a place below Venezuela in the FIFA rankings at 57th, India entered their final game of the tour aiming for a positive result.

posts.title: ISL 2021-22: Rampant Mumbai City FC put five past ATK Mohun Bagan in big win
posts.desc: Antonio Lopez Habas retained trust in the same set of players that won bragging right in the Kolkata derby over the weekend.

posts.title: Men's Junior Hockey World Cup 2021: India beat Belgium 1-0 to reach semis, on course to defend title
posts.desc: Shardananad Tiwari's penalty corner conversion in the 21st minute was enough for India to seal their place in the last four.

posts.title: BWF World Championships: PV Sindhu gets first round bye in tournament draw, likely to face Tai Tzu Ying in quarters
posts.desc: Sindhu, who won a bronze in the Tokyo Olympics, has been seeded sixth in the 12-19 December showpiece event.

posts.title: 'I just ran out of steam': British tennis player Johanna Konta announces retirement from sport
posts.desc: The 30-year-old Konta reached a high in the rankings of No 4 and was a four-time title winner on the WTA.

posts.title: Men's Junior Hockey World Cup 2021: Six-time champions Germany, Argentina enter semis
posts.desc: In the first quarter-final of the day, Germany eked out a narrow 3-1 win over Spain in the shoot-out after both the teams were locked at 2-2 in regulation time, before Argentina beat Netherlands 2-1.

posts.title: Saina Nehwal to give World Championships a miss for the first time as injuries derail star shuttler's season
posts.desc: Nehwal, who has won a silver and bronze besides eight quarter-final finishes in the World Championships over the years, is recovering from a groin pull and knee injury.

posts.title: Eighth edition of Pro Kabaddi League to begin from 22 December; Bengaluru to host entire season
posts.desc: As a special format for PKL Season 8, Mashal has scheduled 'Triple Headers' on the first four days

posts.title: Tiger Woods refuses to put timetable on return to tournament golf after recovering from car crash
posts.desc: Woods, 45, told Golf Digest in an interview on Monday his days as a full-time professional golfer were over, saying that he would pick and choose tournaments from now on.

posts.title: Premier League: Teemu Pukki helps Norwich deny 10-man Newcastle first win of season
posts.desc: Pukki smashed home on the volley to equalise 11 minutes from time and Norwich should have claimed a massive three points in stoppage time when Martin Dubravka saved from Pierre Lees-Melou.

posts.title: Davis Cup: Germany win decisive doubles encounter to knock Great Britain out, enter semi-finals
posts.desc: Britainâ€™s Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski looked destined to force a third set, but Kevin Krawietz and Tim Puetz won the final seven points to help Germany book a clash with Russia or Sweden in Madrid on Saturday

posts.title: Serie A: Juventus register hard-fought win over Salernitana; Atalanta register fourth consecutive win
posts.desc: Paulo Dybala and Alvaro Morata struck the goals which gave struggling Juve the points at the Stadio Arechi but they stay seventh, seven points behind Atalanta who sit fourth in the final Champions League spot.
